channel.title: Crypto News - SosoValue Research
channel.description: Latest crypto news from SosoValue Research

item.title: US court restarts trademark lawsuit related to Yuga Labs, rules BAYC NFT is a protectable trademarkA U.S. court has reinstated Yuga Labs' trademark lawsuit against conceptual artist Ryder Ripps and developer Jeremy Cahen. The court ruled that a jury must decide whether the duo's parody NFT series misled consumers. Yuga Labs co-founder Greg Solano said that the court found in this appeal that Yuga's BAYC NFTs are protectable trademarks and not purely a scam, and also confirmed that NFTs can be protected as "goods" under the Lanham Act, rejecting arguments that NFTs are too intangible to qualify for trademark protection under U.S. law. [Foresight News]

item.title: A whale address that has been dormant for 14.5 years has been awakened. The address holds nearly 4,000 BTC, with an average holding cost of $0.375.According to on-chain analyst Ember, an ancient whale that accumulated 3,962.6 BTC 14 and a half years ago (January 2011) ended its dormancy 20 minutes ago and made a test transfer. When this address accumulated these BTC in 2011, the price of BTC was only $0.375. Today, 14 and a half years later, the price of BTC is 315,000.0 times what it was then. [Odaily]

item.title: Hotcoin brand refresh, airdrop of 1,000 Labubu to launch a global creative solicitation, igniting the summer shanzhai season.On July 24th, the global crypto asset trading platform Hotcoin announced the renewal of its official website and launched the "Trading Cute Friends" global creative doll clothing solicitation event in collaboration with the well-known trendy toy IP Labubu. From now until July 31st, users can go to the official Twitter account (@hotcoinzh) to receive the new brand logo integrated into Labubu's creative doll clothing, and have the opportunity to share 1,000 sets of customized physical dolls. The final winning work selected by popular vote will be officially adopted and mass-produced, and the creator will also have the opportunity to receive $ETH in prize money. This brand upgrade and cross-border linkage marks Hotcoin's focus on creating a younger crypto new ecosystem, and welcoming the hot altcoin season together with community users. [Techflow]

item.title: Hong Kong to criminalize unlicensed stablecoin promotion from AugustOn July 24, according to Cointelegraph, Hong Kong will begin to implement the Stablecoin Ordinance on August 1, 2025, prohibiting the provision or promotion of unlicensed fiat-backed stablecoins (FRS) to retail investors. Violators may be fined up to HK$50,000.00 and imprisoned for six months. The Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) issued a warning on Wednesday, reminding investors to stay away from unlicensed stablecoins to avoid accidentally violating the law. HKMA President Yu Weiwen said that the new regulations are aimed at bringing credibility and stability to the stablecoin industry while protecting investors from fraud and excessive speculation. Although there are currently as many as 50 companies applying for stablecoin licenses, most applications lack practical implementation plans and only a few licenses will be approved. [PANews]

item.title:
Building crypto vaults with Veda co-founder Sun RaghupathiEpisode 35 of The Crypto Beat was recorded with The Block's Head of Growth, Tim Copeland, and Veda co-founder and CEO Sun Raghupathi.
Listen below, and subscribe to The Crypto Beat on YouTube,Apple,Spotify, Twitch or wherever you listen to podcasts. Please send feedback and revision requests to[emailprotected]
Tim and Sun discussed how DeFi vaults are simplifying complex finance systems and looking to drive mainstream and institutional adoption. Sun explained on Veda's Vault architecture, the importance of security, and the evolving competitive landscape in the DeFi space.
OUTLINE 00:00 – Introduction 00:25 – What is Veda? 03:31 – Potential Contagion Risks 04:30 – GMX Hack 05:39 – DeFi Hacks 08:16 – Challenges of Building Vaults 09:48 – DeFi's Evolution 15:23 – Institutional Involvement 16:58 – Vault Uses in TradFi 17:47 – Tokenized Stocks 20:44 – Vaults vs. Staking 22:48 – Types of Vault Strategies 24:39 – AI in Vault Management 25:47 – Veda’s Future Plans 26:37 – Conclusion

item.title: Gate Wallet launches BNB and XRP incentive activities to support the use of on-chain assetsOn July 24, according to an official announcement, Gate Wallet hit a new high around the price of BNB and officially launched two online incentive activities covering the two major assets of BNB and XRP. During the event, new users who complete their first BNB transaction in their wallet (amount ≥ $100) can receive a maximum $10.00 airdrop, limited to the first 1,000 participants. All users who top up BNB can also share a $10,000.00 prize pool based on their top-up ratio, with a maximum single-person reward of $100.00. In the XRP incentive activity, users who deposit no less than 10 XRP can participate in the $5,000.00 airdrop; those who complete XRP transactions (amount ≥ $50.00) can also participate in the $20,000.00 prize pool. The rewards are distributed according to the transaction ratio, and a single person can get up to $200.00. The activity ends on August 10. Gate Wallet is the industry-leading multi-chain crypto wallet, connecting 100+ public chains, millions of assets and tens of thousands of DApps in one stop, opening up a professional-level Web3 experience and providing the best solution for every Web3 need. [PANews]

item.title: On-chain detective ZachXBT: Some projects are running Yaps campaigns to attract low-quality users and AI-generated content, which will only dilute brand value.On-chain detective ZachXBT posted on his personal channel, pointing out that some projects are currently attracting low-quality users and AI-generated content by running Yaps campaigns, which dilutes brand value and fails to bring long-term funds and real user growth. He called on the community to actively block related projects and question false data indicators in order to curb the "proliferation of low-quality content" in the ecosystem. [Odaily]

item.title: Nansen data: In the past 7 days, the number of active addresses and transactions on Linea have both surged by over 100%.According to Nansen data, possibly influenced by the upcoming announcement related to the TGE this month, the number of active addresses and transactions on Linea has surged by over 100% in the past 7 days. On July 21st, the number of active addresses reached 75,700.00, the highest in nearly four months; the number of transactions on the same day exceeded 200,000.00, the first time in nearly 5 months. [Wu Blockchain]

item.title: AVNU Launches Starknet Paymaster, Enabling Developers to Sponsor User Gas Fees in 5 MinutesAVNU, a trading center on Starknet, has announced the launch of Starknet Paymaster, an open-source, production-ready, developer-first method for extracting Gas fees. It allows Starknet developers to sponsor or extract user fees in 5 minutes, accepting any token as a Gas fee. [Foresight News]

item.title: Bitget Research Institute: Altseason Index Shows an Upward Trend, Funds May Rotate to Altcoins in the Short TermBitget Research Institute's chief analyst Ryan Lee stated that Bitcoin's dominance has recently fallen back to the 59%-61% range, while the altcoin season index shows an upward trend, indicating that funds are rotating towards mainstream altcoins such as Ethereum, XRP, and Solana, with related assets rising by 20%-40% recently. Ryan Lee pointed out, "The active performance of sectors such as AI, RWA, and Memecoin also shows the market's strong focus on specific narratives. However, the altcoin season index has not yet broken through the 75% confirmation threshold, and the current market is more likely a phase of rotation rather than a full-blown altcoin season. To drive the market to continue into the mid-to-late third quarter, the key lies in whether Bitcoin's market share can remain below 60%. At the same time, institutional fund inflows, regulatory benefits, and improved fundamentals in the Layer 1 and DeFi sectors are all important signals to confirm the start of the altcoin season." [Odaily News]

item.title: Solana developers consider increasing block limit by 66% to 100 million compute units to further increase network capacitySolana developers are considering increasing the block limit from 60 million compute units to 100 million compute units via the SIMD-0286 proposal, which would achieve a 66% capacity increase, provided validators opt-in to the upgrade. The proposal aims to further increase Solana network capacity, allowing for more transactions per second to be processed. Compute units are the basic unit of measurement for transaction complexity and resource consumption in the Solana network, and increasing the block compute unit limit will directly enhance the network's transaction processing capabilities. (The Block) [Odaily]

item.title: UK-listed Satsuma Completes Over £100.00M Funding Round, Will Accelerate its Bitcoin Accumulation StrategyUK-listed Satsuma Technology PLC (Tao Alpha PLC) has announced the completion of its second round of convertible bond private placement, with the amount raised significantly exceeding the original minimum target of £100.00M. Satsuma stated that the financing will be used to expand its business and strengthen its Bitcoin adoption and decentralized AI strategy. The relevant convertible bond shares will be applied for listing on the London Main Board market after conversion. [Wu Blockchain]

This platform has been active for a long time and is one of the main trading places for Stealer tools (information stealers) in the cryptocurrency industry. [Odaily]

item.title: Bifrost Launches $3.00M Multi-Chain Liquidity Incentive to Drive Polkadot DeFi into a Multi-Chain EcosystemOn July 24th, to open up asset channels between Polkadot and the mainstream multi-chain ecosystem, vDOT/ETH and vDOT/BNB liquidity pools will be officially launched on Uniswap V4 on July 25th, and a 12-month liquidity incentive program with a total of 795,000 DOT incentives will be launched simultaneously. This integration provides DOT with a stable and sustainable liquidity entry point into the Ethereum ecosystem, expanding its actual usability in mainstream DeFi networks. As part of the DeFi Singularity program, the first round of incentives now covers Arbitrum, Base, BNB Chain, and the Ethereum mainnet, and liquidity rewards are simultaneously launched around the vDOT/ETH and DOT/ETH pools. Users can participate in liquidity provision through Uniswap V4 and receive incentives in real-time on the Merkl platform. vDOT is a DOT liquid staking token launched by Bifrost, and currently has a cumulative staked TVL of over $74,000,000.00, widely used in governance, lending, DEX and other scenarios. This round of incentives is seen as an important step in promoting vDOT to become a multi-chain yield-bearing asset, and also brings higher liquidity and DeFi integration potential to DOT. [Techflow]

item.title: Crypto mining firm Bitzero announces completion of $25.00M fundingBitzero, a crypto mining company backed by renowned investor Kevin O'Leary, has announced the completion of a $25.00M funding round, which it intends to use to expand its business footprint in North America and Europe. The company stated that it will initially use part of the funds to purchase 2,900 Bitmain S21 Pro miners, which are expected to be deployed within 4 to 6 months, increasing annual revenue by approximately $10.00M. Headquartered in Vancouver, Bitzero focuses on using low-carbon energy sources such as hydropower to support high-performance computing and blockchain tasks, and is currently advancing the construction of four new facilities in North Dakota, Norway, and Finland. [TheBlock]

item.title: UK and India sign free trade agreementOn July 24, Bloomberg reported that the UK and India have officially signed a free trade agreement, eliminating tariffs on a number of products including cars and alcohol. The agreement was reached after three years of negotiations. It is the largest trade agreement since the UK's withdrawal from the EU and the most important trade agreement for India in a decade. According to the agreement, 90% of tariff items exported by the UK to India will be reduced, of which 85% will be completely duty-free within ten years; 99% of tariff items exported by India to the UK will also be reduced. The agreement is expected to increase the output of the UK economy by 4.8 billion pounds per year and bring long-term trade growth to the two countries. [PANews]
